 1288: test_invalid_keymap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1289:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
 1290:     Term1 = setup_tty([{args, ["-config", DataDir ++ "invalid_keymap.config"]} | Config]),
 1291:     try
 1292:         check_content(Term1, "Invalid key"),
 1293:         check_content(Term1, "Invalid function"),
 1294:         send_tty(Term1, "asdf"),
 1295:         send_tty(Term1, "C-u"),
 1296:         check_content(Term1, ">$"),
 1297:         ok
 1298:     after
 1299:         stop_tty(Term1),
 1300:         ok
 1301:     end.
 1302: external_editor(Config) ->
 1303:     case os:find_executable("nano") of
 1304:         false -> {skip, "nano is not installed"};
 1305:         _ ->
 1306:             Term = start_tty(Config),
 1307:             try
 1308:                 tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1309:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"EDITOR\",\"nano\").\n"),
 1310:                 send_tty(Term, "\"some text with\nnewline in it\""),
 1311:                 check_content(Term,"3> \"some text with\\s*\n.+\\s*newline in it\""),
 1312:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"),
 1313:                 check_content(Term,"GNU nano [\\d.]+"),
 1314:                 check_content(Term,"\"some text with\\s*\n\\s*newline in it\""),
 1315:                 send_tty(Term, "Right"),
 1316:                 send_tty(Term, "still"),
 1317:                 send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1318:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% save in nano
 1319:                 send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1320:                 send_tty(Term, "C-X"), %% quit in nano
 1321:                 check_content(Term,"3> \"still\\s*\n\\s*.+\\s*some text with\\s*\n.+\\s*newline in it\""),
 1322:                 send_tty(Term,".\n"),
 1323:                 check_content(Term,"\\Q\"still\\nsome text with\\nnewline in it\"\\E"),
 1324:                 ok
 1325:             after
 1326:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1327:                 ok
 1328:             end
 1329:     end.
 1330: 
 1331: external_editor_visual(Config) ->
 1332:     case os:find_executable("vim") of
 1333:         false ->
 1334:             {skip, "vim is not installed"};
 1335:         _ ->
 1336:             Term = start_tty(Config),
 1337:             try
 1338:                 tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1339:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"EDITOR\",\"nano\").\n"),
 1340:                 check_content(Term, "3>"),
 1341:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"VISUAL\",\"vim -u DEFAULTS -U NONE -i NONE\").\n"),
 1342:                 check_content(Term, "4>"),
 1343:                 send_tty(Term,"\"hello"),
 1344:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% Open vim
 1345:                 check_content(Term, "^\"hello"),
 1346:                 send_tty(Term, "$"), %% Set cursor at end
 1347:                 send_tty(Term, "a"), %% Enter insert mode at end
 1348:                 check_content(Term, "-- INSERT --"),
 1349:                 send_tty(Term, "\"."),
 1350:                 send_tty(Term,"Escape"),
 1351:                 send_tty(Term,":wq"),
 1352:                 send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1353:                 check_content(Term, "\"hello\"[.]$"),
 1354:                 send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1355:                 check_content(Term, "\"hello\""),
 1356:                 check_content(Term, "5>$")
 1357:             after
 1358:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1359:                 ok
 1360:             end
 1361:     end.
 1362: 
 1363: external_editor_unicode(Config) ->
 1364:     NanoPath = os:find_executable("nano"),
 1365:     case NanoPath of
 1366:         false -> {skip, "nano is not installed"};
 1367:         _ ->
 1368:             Term = start_tty(Config),
 1369:             try
 1370:                 tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1371:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"EDITOR\",\"nano\").\n"),
 1372:                 send_tty(Term, hard_unicode()),
 1373:                 check_content(Term,"3> " ++ hard_unicode_match(Config)),
 1374:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% open external editor (nano)
 1375:                 check_content(Term,"GNU nano [\\d.]+"),
 1376:                 send_tty(Term, "still "),
 1377:                 check_content(Term,"\nstill "),
 1378:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% save in nano
 1379:                 send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1380:                 send_tty(Term, "C-X"), %% quit in nano
 1381:                 check_content(Term,"still "++hard_unicode_match(Config)),
 1382:                 ok
 1383:             after
 1384:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1385:                 ok
 1386:             end
 1387:     end.
 1388: 
 1389: %% There used to be a race condition when using shell:start_interactive where
 1390: %% the newline handling of standard_error did not change correctly to compensate
 1391: %% for the tty changing to canonical mode
 1392: shell_standard_error_nlcr(Config) ->
 1393: 
 1394:     [
 1395:      begin
 1396:          Term = setup_tty([{env,[{"TERM",TERM}]},{args, ["-noshell"]} | Config]),
 1397:          try
 1398:              rpc(Term, io, format, [standard_error,"test~ntest~ntest", []]),
 1399:              check_content(Term, "test\ntest\ntest$"),
 1400:              rpc(Term, fun() -> shell:start_interactive(),
 1401:                                 io:format(standard_error,"test~ntest~ntest", [])
 1402:                        end),
 1403:              check_content(Term, "test\ntest\ntest(\n|.)*test\ntest\ntest")
 1404:          after
 1405:              stop_tty(Term)
 1406:          end
 1407:      end || TERM <- ["dumb",os:getenv("TERM")]].
 1408: 
 1409: %% We test that suspending of `erl` and then resuming restores the shell
 1410: shell_suspend(Config) ->
 1411: 
 1412:     Name = peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path,Config)),
 1413:     %% In order to suspend `erl` we need it to run in a shell that has job control
 1414:     %% so we start the peer within a tmux window instead of having it be the original
 1415:     %% process.
 1416:     os:cmd("tmux new-window -n " ++ Name ++ " -d -- bash --norc"),
 1417: 
 1418:     Peer = #{ name => Name,
 1419:               post_process_args =>
 1420:                         fun(["new-window","-n",_,"-d","--"|CmdAndArgs]) ->
 1421:                                 FlatCmdAndArgs =
 1422:                                       lists:join(
 1423:                                         " ",[[$',A,$'] || A <- CmdAndArgs]),
 1424:                                 ["send","-t",Name,lists:flatten(FlatCmdAndArgs),"Enter"]
 1425:                         end
 1426:             },
 1427: 
 1428: 
 1429:     Term = start_tty([{peer, Peer}|Config]),
 1430: 
 1431:     try
 1432:         send_tty(Term, hard_unicode()),
 1433:         check_content(Term,["2> ",hard_unicode(),"$"]),
 1434:         send_tty(Term, "C-Z"),
 1435:         check_content(Term,"\\Q[1]+\\E\\s*Stopped"),
 1436:         send_tty(Term, "fg"),
 1437:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1438:         send_tty(Term, "M-l"),
 1439:         check_content(Term,["2> ",hard_unicode(),"$"]),
 1440:         check_location(Term,{0,width(hard_unicode())}),
 1441:         ok
 1442:     after
 1443:         stop_tty(Term),
 1444:         ok
 1445:     end.
 1446: 
 1447: %% We test that suspending of `erl` and then resuming restores the shell
 1448: shell_full_queue(Config) ->
 1449: 
 1450:     [throw({skip,"Need unbuffered to run"}) || os:find_executable("unbuffered") =:= false],
 1451: 
 1452:     %% In order to fill the read buffer of the terminal we need to get a
 1453:     %% bit creative. We first need to start erl in bash in order to be
 1454:     %% able to get access to job control for suspended processes.
 1455:     %% We then also wrap `erl` in `unbuffer -p` so that we can suspend
 1456:     %% that program in order to block writing to stdout for a while.
 1457: 
 1458:     Name = peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path,Config)),
 1459:     os:cmd("tmux new-window -n " ++ Name ++ " -d -- bash --norc"),
 1460: 
 1461:     Peer = #{ name => Name,
 1462:               post_process_args =>
 1463:                         fun(["new-window","-n",_,"-d","--"|CmdAndArgs]) ->
 1464:                                 FlatCmdAndArgs = ["unbuffer -p "] ++
 1465:                                       lists:join(
 1466:                                         " ",[[$',A,$'] || A <- CmdAndArgs]),
 1467:                                 ["send","-t",Name,lists:flatten(FlatCmdAndArgs),"Enter"]
 1468:                         end
 1469:             },
 1470: 
 1471: 
 1472:     Term = start_tty([{peer, Peer}|Config]),
 1473: 
 1474:     UnbufferedPid = os:cmd("ps -o ppid= -p " ++ rpc(Term,os,getpid,[])),
 1475: 
 1476:     WriteUntilStopped =
 1477:         fun F(Char) ->
 1478:                 rpc(Term,io,format,[user,[Char],[]]),
 1479:                 put(bytes,get(bytes,0)+1),
 1480:                 receive
 1481:                     stop ->
 1482:                         rpc(Term,io,format,[user,[Char+1],[]])
 1483:                 after 0 -> F(Char)
 1484:                 end
 1485:         end,
 1486: 
 1487:     WaitUntilBlocked =
 1488:         fun(Pid, Ref) ->
 1489:                 (fun F(Cnt) ->
 1490:                          receive
 1491:                              {'DOWN',Ref,_,_,_} = Down ->
 1492:                                  ct:fail({io_format_did_not_block, Down})
 1493:                          after 1000 ->
 1494:                                  ok
 1495:                          end,
 1496:                          case process_info(Pid,dictionary) of
 1497:                              {dictionary,[{bytes,Cnt}]} ->
 1498:                                  ct:log("Bytes until blocked: ~p~n",[Cnt]),
 1499:                                  %% Add one extra byte as for
 1500:                                  %% the current blocking call
 1501:                                  Cnt + 1;
 1502:                              {dictionary,[{bytes,NewCnt}]} ->
 1503:                                  F(NewCnt)
 1504:                          end
 1505:                  end)(0)
 1506:         end,
 1507: 
 1508:     try
 1509:         %% First test that we can suspend and then resume
 1510:         os:cmd("kill -TSTP " ++ UnbufferedPid),
 1511:         check_content(Term,"\\Q[1]+\\E\\s*Stopped"),
 1512:         {Pid, Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> WriteUntilStopped($a) end),
 1513:         WaitUntilBlocked(Pid, Ref),
 1514:         send_tty(Term, "fg"),
 1515:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1516:         Pid ! stop,
 1517:         check_content(Term,"b$"),
 1518: 
 1519:         send_tty(Term, "."),
 1520:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1521: 
 1522:         %% Then we test that all characters are written when system
 1523:         %% is terminated just after writing
 1524:         {ok,Cols} = rpc(Term,io,columns,[user]),
 1525:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1526:         os:cmd("kill -TSTP " ++ UnbufferedPid),
 1527:         check_content(Term,"\\Q[1]+\\E\\s*Stopped"),
 1528:         {Pid2, Ref2} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> WriteUntilStopped($c) end),
 1529:         Bytes = WaitUntilBlocked(Pid2, Ref2) - 1,
 1530:         stop_tty(Term),
 1531:         send_tty(Term, "fg"),
 1532:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1533:         check_content(
 1534:           fun() ->
 1535:                   tmux(["capture-pane -p -S - -E - -t ",tty_name(Term)])
 1536:           end, lists:flatten([lists:duplicate(Cols,$c) ++ "\n" ||
 1537:                                  _ <- lists:seq(1,(Bytes) div Cols)]
 1538:                              ++ [lists:duplicate((Bytes) rem Cols,$c)])),
 1539:         ct:log("~ts",[tmux(["capture-pane -p -S - -E - -t ",tty_name(Term)])]),
 1540:         ok
 1541:     after
 1542:         stop_tty(Term),
 1543:         ok
 1544:     end.
 1545: 
 1546: get(Key,Default) ->
 1547:     case get(Key) of
 1548:         undefined ->
 1549:             Default;
 1550:         Value ->
 1551:             Value
 1552:     end.
 1553: 
 1554: %% A list of unicode graphemes that are notoriously hard to render
 1555: hard_unicode() ->
 1556:     ZWJ =
 1557:         case os:type() of
 1558:             %% macOS has very good rendering of ZWJ,
 1559:             %% but the cursor does not agree with it..
 1560:             {unix, darwin} -> [];
 1561:             _ -> [[16#1F91A,16#1F3FC]]    % Hand with skintone 
 1562:         end,
 1563:     [[16#1f600],             % Smilie 
 1564:     "",                   % Hangul
 1565:     "Z","a","l","g","o" %% Vertically stacked chars
 1566:      %%"",            % Zero width joiner
 1567:      %%""                % Zero width joiner
 1568:      | ZWJ].
 1569: 
 1570: hard_unicode_match(Config) ->
 1571:     ["\\Q",[unicode_to_octet(Config, U) || U <- hard_unicode()],"\\E"].
 1572: 
 1573: unicode_to_octet(Config, U) ->
 1574:     case ?config(encoding,Config) of
 1575:         unicode -> U;
 1576:         latin1 -> unicode_to_octet(U)
 1577:     end.
 1578: 
 1579: unicode_to_octet(U) ->
 1580:     [if Byte >= 128 -> [$\\,integer_to_list(Byte,8)];
 1581:         true -> Byte
 1582:      end || <<Byte>> <= unicode:characters_to_binary(U)].
 1583: 
 1584: unicode_to_hex(Config, U) ->
 1585:     case ?config(encoding,Config) of
 1586:         unicode -> U;
 1587:         latin1 -> unicode_to_hex(U)
 1588:     end.
 1589: 
 1590: unicode_to_hex(U) when is_integer(U) ->
 1591:     unicode_to_hex([U]);
 1592: unicode_to_hex(Us) ->
 1593:     [if U < 128 -> U;
 1594:         U < 512 -> ["\\",integer_to_list(U,8)];
 1595:         true -> ["\\x{",integer_to_list(U,16),"}"]
 1596:      end || U <- Us].
 1597: 
 1598: width(C, Str) ->
 1599:     case ?config(encoding, C) of
 1600:         unicode -> width(Str);
 1601:         latin1 -> width(unicode_to_octet(Str))
 1602:     end.
 1603: width(Str) ->
 1604:     lists:sum(
 1605:       [npwcwidth(CP) || CP <- lists:flatten(Str)]).
 1606: 
 1607: npwcwidth(CP) ->
 1608:     try prim_tty:npwcwidth(CP)
 1609:     catch error:undef ->
 1610:             if CP =:= 16#D55C ->
 1611:                     2; %% 
 1612:                CP =:= 16#1f91A ->
 1613:                     2; %% hand
 1614:                CP =:= 16#1F3Fc ->
 1615:                     2; %% Skintone
 1616:                CP =:= 16#1f600 ->
 1617:                     2; %% smilie
 1618:                true ->
 1619:                     case lists:member(CP, [775,776,780,785,786,787,788,791,793,794,
 1620:                                            804,813,848,852,854,858,871,875,878]) of
 1621:                         true ->
 1622:                             0;
 1623:                         false ->
 1624:                             1
 1625:                     end
 1626:             end
 1627:     end.
 1628: 
 1629: tmux([Cmd|_] = Command) when is_list(Cmd) ->
 1630:     tmux(lists:concat(Command));
 1631: tmux(Command) ->
 1632:     string:trim(os:cmd(["tmux ",Command])).
 1633: 
 1634: rpc(#tmux{ node = N }, Fun) ->
 1635:     erpc:call(N, Fun).
 1636: rpc(#tmux{ node = N }, M, F, A) ->
 1637:     erpc:call(N, M, F, A).
 1638: 
 1639: %% Setup a TTY, but do not type anything in terminal
 1640: setup_tty(Config) ->
 1641:     Name = maps:get(name,proplists:get_value(peer, Config, #{}),
 1642:                     peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path, Config))),
 1643: 
 1644:     Envs = lists:flatmap(fun({Key,Value}) ->
 1645:                                  ["-env",Key,Value]
 1646:                          end, proplists:get_value(env,Config,[])),
 1647: 
 1648:     ExtraArgs = proplists:get_value(args,Config,[]),
 1649: 
 1650:     ExecArgs = case os:getenv("TMUX_DEBUG") of
 1651:                    "strace" ->
 1652:                        STraceLog = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1653:                                                  Name++".strace"),
 1654:                        ct:pal("Link to strace: file://~ts", [STraceLog]),
 1655:                        [os:find_executable("strace"),"-f",
 1656:                         "-o",STraceLog,
 1657:                         "-e","trace=all",
 1658:                         "-e","read=0,1,2",
 1659:                         "-e","write=0,1,2"
 1660:                        ] ++ string:split(ct:get_progname()," ",all);
 1661:                    "rr" ->
 1662:                        [os:find_executable("cerl"),"-rr"];
 1663:                    _ ->
 1664:                        string:split(ct:get_progname()," ",all)
 1665:                end,
 1666:     DefaultPeerArgs = #{ name => Name,
 1667:                          exec =>
 1668:                              {os:find_executable("tmux"),
 1669:                               ["new-window","-n",Name,"-d","--"] ++ ExecArgs },
 1670: 
 1671:                          args => ["-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1672:                                   "-connect_all","false",
 1673: %                                  "-kernel","logger_level","all",
 1674:                                   "-kernel","shell_history","disabled",
 1675:                                   "-kernel","prevent_overlapping_partitions","false",
 1676:                                   "-eval","shell:prompt_func({interactive_shell_SUITE,prompt})."
 1677:                                  ] ++ Envs ++ ExtraArgs,
 1678:                          detached => false
 1679:                        },
 1680: 
 1681:     {ok, Peer, Node} =
 1682:         ?CT_PEER(maps:merge(proplists:get_value(peer,Config,#{}),
 1683:                             DefaultPeerArgs)),
 1684: 
 1685:     Self = self(),
 1686: 
 1687:     %% By default peer links with the starter. For these TCs we however only
 1688:     %% want the peer to die if we die, so we create a "unidirection link" using
 1689:     %% monitors.
 1690:     spawn(fun() ->
 1691:                   TCRef = erlang:monitor(process, Self),
 1692:                   PeerRef = erlang:monitor(process, Peer),
 1693:                   receive
 1694:                       {'DOWN',TCRef,_,_,Reason} ->
 1695:                           exit(Peer, Reason);
 1696:                       {'DOWN',PeerRef,_,_,_} ->
 1697:                           ok
 1698:                   end
 1699:           end),
 1700:     unlink(Peer),
 1701: 
 1702:     "" = tmux(["set-option -t ",Name," remain-on-exit on"]),
 1703: 
 1704:     %% We start tracing on the remote node in order to help debugging
 1705:     TraceLog = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),Name++".trace"),
 1706:     ct:log("Link to trace: file://~ts",[TraceLog]),
 1707: 
 1708:     spawn(Node,
 1709:           fun() ->
 1710:                   {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(file,TraceLog),
 1711:                   %% dbg:p(whereis(user_drv),[c,m]),
 1712:                   %% dbg:p(whereis(user_drv_writer),[c,m]),
 1713:                   %% dbg:p(whereis(user_drv_reader),[c,m]),
 1714:                   %% dbg:tp(user_drv,x),
 1715:                   %% dbg:tp(prim_tty,x),
 1716:                   %% dbg:tpl(prim_tty,write_nif,x),
 1717:                   %% dbg:tpl(prim_tty,read_nif,x),
 1718:                   monitor(process, Self),
 1719:                   receive _ -> ok end
 1720:           end),
 1721: 
 1722:     #tmux{ peer = Peer, node = Node, name = Name }.
 1723: 
 1724: %% Start a tty, setup custom prompt and set cursor at bottom
 1725: start_tty(Config) ->
 1726: 
 1727:     Term = setup_tty(Config),
 1728: 
 1729:     Prompt = fun() -> ["\e[94m",54620,44397,50612,47,51312,49440,47568,"\e[0m"] end,
 1730:     erpc:call(Term#tmux.node, application, set_env,
 1731:               [stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test,
 1732:                proplists:get_value(shell_prompt_func_test, Config, Prompt)]),
 1733: 
 1734:     {Rows, _} = get_window_size(Term),
 1735: 
 1736:     %% We send a lot of newlines here in order for the number of rows
 1737:     %% in the window to be max so that we can predict what the cursor
 1738:     %% position is.
 1739:     [send_tty(Term,"\n") || _ <- lists:seq(1, Rows)],
 1740: 
 1741:     %% We enter an 'a' here so that we can get the correct orig position
 1742:     %% with an alternative prompt.
 1743:     send_tty(Term,"a.\n"),
 1744:     check_content(Term,"2>$"),
 1745:     OrigLocation = get_location(Term),
 1746:     Term#tmux{ orig_location = OrigLocation }.
 1747: 
 1748: prompt(L) ->
 1749:     N = proplists:get_value(history, L, 0),
 1750:     Fun = application:get_env(stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test,
 1751:                               fun() -> atom_to_list(node()) end),
 1752:     io_lib:format("(~ts)~w> ",[Fun(),N]).
 1753: 
 1754: stop_tty(Term) ->
 1755:     catch peer:stop(Term#tmux.peer),
 1756:     ct:log("~ts",[get_content(Term, "-e")]),
 1757: %    "" = tmux("kill-window -t " ++ Term#tmux.name),
 1758:     ok.
 1759: 
 1760: tty_name(Term) ->
 1761:     Term#tmux.name.
 1762: 
 1763: send_tty(Term, "Home") ->
 1764:     %% https://stackoverflow.com/a/55616731
 1765:     send_tty(Term,"Escape"),
 1766:     send_tty(Term,"OH");
 1767: send_tty(Term, "End") ->
 1768:     send_tty(Term,"Escape"),
 1769:     send_tty(Term,"OF");
 1770: send_tty(#tmux{ name = Name } = _Term,Value) ->
 1771:     [Head | Quotes] = string:split(Value, "'", all),
 1772:     "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " '" ++ Head ++ "'"),
 1773:     [begin
 1774:          "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " \"'\""),
 1775:          "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " '" ++ V ++ "'")
 1776:      end || V <- Quotes].
 1777: 
 1778: %% We use send_stdin for testing of things that we cannot sent via
 1779: %% the tmux send command, such as invalid unicode
 1780: send_stdin(Term, Chars) when is_binary(Chars) ->
 1781:     rpc(Term,erlang,display_string,[stdin,Chars]);
 1782: send_stdin(Term, Chars) ->
 1783:     send_stdin(Term, iolist_to_binary(unicode:characters_to_binary(Chars))).
 1784: 
 1785: check_location(Term, Where) ->
 1786:     check_location(Term, Where, 5).
 1787: check_location(#tmux{ orig_location = {OrigRow, OrigCol} = Orig } = Term,
 1788:                {AdjRow, AdjCol} = Where, Attempt) ->
 1789:     NewLocation = get_location(Term),
 1790:     case {OrigRow+AdjRow,OrigCol+AdjCol} of
 1791:         NewLocation -> NewLocation;
 1792:         _ when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 1793:             {NewRow, NewCol} = NewLocation,
 1794:             ct:fail({wrong_location, {expected,{AdjRow, AdjCol}},
 1795:                      {got,{NewRow - OrigRow, NewCol - OrigCol},
 1796:                       {NewLocation, Orig}}});
 1797:         _ ->
 1798:             timer:sleep(50),
 1799:             check_location(Term, Where, Attempt -1)
 1800:     end.
 1801: 
 1802: get_location(Term) ->
 1803:     RowAndCol = tmux("display -pF '#{cursor_y} #{cursor_x}' -t "++Term#tmux.name),
 1804:     [Row, Col] = string:lexemes(string:trim(RowAndCol,both)," "),
 1805:     {list_to_integer(Row), list_to_integer(Col)}.
 1806: 
 1807: get_window_size(Term) ->
 1808:     RowAndCol = tmux("display -pF '#{window_height} #{window_width}' -t "++Term#tmux.name),
 1809:     [Row, Col] = string:lexemes(string:trim(RowAndCol,both)," "),
 1810:     {list_to_integer(Row), list_to_integer(Col)}.
 1811: 
 1812: check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch) ->
 1813:     check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, #{}, 5).
 1814: check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, Opts, Attempt) ->
 1815:     Opts = #{},
 1816:     OrigContent = case Term of
 1817:         #tmux{} -> get_content(Term);
 1818:         Fun when is_function(Fun,0) -> Fun()
 1819:     end,
 1820:     Content = case maps:find(replace, Opts) of
 1821:                 {ok, {RE,Repl} } ->
 1822:                     re:replace(OrigContent, RE, Repl, [global]);
 1823:                 error ->
 1824:                     OrigContent
 1825:                 end,
 1826:     case re:run(string:trim(Content, both), lists:flatten(NegativeMatch), [unicode]) of
 1827:         {match,_} ->
 1828:             io:format("Failed, found '~ts' in ~n'~ts'~n",
 1829:             [unicode:characters_to_binary(NegativeMatch), Content]),
 1830:             io:format("Failed, found '~w' in ~n'~w'~n",
 1831:                         [unicode:characters_to_binary(NegativeMatch), Content]),
 1832:             ct:fail(match);
 1833:         _ when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 1834:             ok;
 1835:         _ ->
 1836:             timer:sleep(500),
 1837:             check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, Opts, Attempt - 1)
 1838:     end.
 1839: check_content(Term, Match) ->
 1840:     check_content(Term, Match, #{}).
 1841: check_content(Term, Match, Opts) when is_map(Opts) ->
 1842:     check_content(Term, Match, Opts, 5).
 1843: check_content(Term, Match, Opts, Attempt) ->
 1844:     OrigContent = case Term of
 1845:                   #tmux{} -> get_content(Term);
 1846:                   Fun when is_function(Fun,0) -> Fun()
 1847:               end,
 1848:     Content = case maps:find(replace, Opts) of
 1849:                   {ok, {RE,Repl} } ->
 1850:                       re:replace(OrigContent, RE, Repl, [global]);
 1851:                   error ->
 1852:                       OrigContent
 1853:               end,
 1854:     case re:run(string:trim(Content, both), lists:flatten(Match), [unicode]) of
 1855:         {match,_} ->
 1856:             ok;
 1857:         _ when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 1858:             io:format("Failed to find '~ts' in ~n'~ts'~n",
 1859:                       [unicode:characters_to_binary(Match), Content]),
 1860:             io:format("Failed to find '~w' in ~n'~w'~n",
 1861:                       [unicode:characters_to_binary(Match), Content]),
 1862:             ct:fail(nomatch);
 1863:         _ ->
 1864:             timer:sleep(500),
 1865:             check_content(Term, Match, Opts, Attempt - 1)
 1866:     end.
 1867: 
 1868: get_content(Term) ->
 1869:     get_content(Term, "").
 1870: get_content(#tmux{ name = Name }, Args) ->
 1871:     Content = unicode:characters_to_binary(tmux("capture-pane -p " ++ Args ++ " -t " ++ Name)),
 1872:     case string:split(Content,"a.\na") of
 1873:         [_Ignore,C] ->
 1874:             C;
 1875:         [C] ->
 1876:             C
 1877:     end.
 1878: 
 1879: %% Tests that exit of initial shell restarts shell.
 1880: exit_initial(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1881:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 1882: 	old ->
 1883:             test_exit_initial(old);
 1884:         new ->
 1885:             test_exit_initial(old),
 1886:             test_exit_initial(new)
 1887:     end,
 1888:     ok.
 1889: 
 1890: test_exit_initial(old) ->
 1891:     rtnode:run(
 1892:       [{putline, ""},
 1893:        {putline, "2."},
 1894:        {expect, "2\r\n"},
 1895:        {putline, "exit()."},
 1896:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 1897:        {putline, ""},
 1898:        {putline, "35."},
 1899:        {expect, "35\r\n"}],
 1900:       [], [], ["-oldshell"]);
 1901: test_exit_initial(new) ->
 1902:     rtnode:run(
 1903:       [{putline, ""},
 1904:        {expect, "1> $"},
 1905:        {putline, "2."},
 1906:        {expect, "2"},
 1907:        {putline,"exit()."},
 1908:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 1909:        {expect, "1> $"},
 1910:        {putline, "35."},
 1911:        {expect, "35\r\n"}]).
 1912: 
 1913: stop_during_init(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1914:     {RunErl,_ToErl,[Erl|ErlArgs]} = rtnode:get_progs(),
 1915:     case rtnode:create_tempdir() of
 1916:         {error, Reason} ->
 1917:             {skip, Reason};
 1918:         Tempdir ->
 1919:             XArg = " -kernel shell_history enabled -s init stop",
 1920:             rtnode:start_runerl_command(RunErl, Tempdir, "\\\""++Erl++"\\\""++ErlArgs++XArg),
 1921:             Logs = rtnode:read_logs(Tempdir),
 1922:             rtnode:dump_logs(Logs),
 1923:             nomatch = binary:match(map_get("erlang.log.1", Logs),
 1924:                                    <<"*** ERROR: Shell process terminated! ***">>),
 1925:             ok
 1926:     end.
 1927: 
 1928: %% This testcase tests that the correct wrapping characters are added
 1929: %% When a terminal has the xn flag set, it means that wrapping may not
 1930: %% work as expected and historically the ttysl driver has always inserted
 1931: %% a " \b" (i.e. space + backspace) when an output string ends on that line
 1932: %% in order for the cursor to be at col 0 on the next line instead of col max
 1933: %% on the current line.
 1934: %%
 1935: %% This caused problems when a string was `columns` long and then ended in "\r\n"
 1936: %% as it would first wrap due to " \b" and then output "\r\n" that cause a double
 1937: %% newline to happen.
 1938: %%
 1939: %% This testcase tests that we get a " \b" when we should and we get a "\r\n" when
 1940: %% we should.
 1941: wrap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1942:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 1943:         new ->
 1944:             As = lists:duplicate(20,"a"),
 1945:             rtnode:run(
 1946:               [{putline, "io:columns()."},
 1947:                {expect, "{ok,20}\r\n"},
 1948:                {putline, ["io:format(\"~s\",[lists:duplicate(20,\"a\")])."]},
 1949:                {expect, As ++ " \b"},
 1950:                {putline, ["io:format(\"~s~n~s\",[lists:duplicate(20,\"a\"),lists:duplicate(20,\"a\")])."]},
 1951:                {expect, As ++ "\r\n" ++ As ++ " \b"}
 1952:               ],
 1953:               [],
 1954:               "stty rows 40; stty columns 20; ");
 1955:         _ ->
 1956:             ok
 1957:     end,
 1958:     ok.
 1959: 
 1960: %% This testcase tests that shell_history works as it should.
 1961: %% We use Ctrl + P = Cp=[$\^p] in order to navigate up
 1962: %% We use Ctrl + N = Cp=[$\^n] in order to navigate down
 1963: %% We use Ctrl + B = Cp=[$\^b] in order to navigate left
 1964: %% in the console. We also need to sleep for a while in order
 1965: %% for the system to update the display before we enter more
 1966: %% commands.
 1967: shell_history(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1968:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "basic"),
 1969:     rtnode:run(
 1970:       [{putline, "echo1."},
 1971:        {expect, "echo1\r\n"},
 1972:        {putline, "echo2."},
 1973:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"},
 1974:        {putline, "echo3."},
 1975:        {expect, "echo3\r\n"},
 1976:        {putline, "echo4."},
 1977:        {expect, "echo4\r\n"},
 1978:        {putline, "echo5."},
 1979:        {expect, "echo5\r\n"}
 1980:       ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 1981:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1982:     rtnode:run(
 1983:       [{sleep,100},
 1984:        {putline, ""},
 1985:        %% the init:stop that stopped the node is dropped
 1986:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo5[.]$"},
 1987:        {putdata, [$\n]},
 1988:        {expect, "echo5\r\n"},
 1989:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo5[.]$"},
 1990:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo4[.]$"},
 1991:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo3[.]$"},
 1992:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$"},
 1993:        {putdata, [$\^n]}, {expect, "echo3[.]$"},
 1994:        {putdata, [$\^n]}, {expect, "echo4[.]$"},
 1995:        {putdata, [$\^b]}, {sleep,50}, %% the echo4. (cursor moved one left)
 1996:        {putline, ["ECHO"]},
 1997:        {expect, "echo4ECHO\r\n"}
 1998:       ], [], [],
 1999:       mk_history_param(Path)),
 2000:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 2001: 
 2002:     %% ignore input given after io:get_line, and after h(module) pager
 2003:     rtnode:run(
 2004:        [{putdata, "io:get_line(\"getline>\").\n"},
 2005:         {expect, "getline>"},
 2006:         {putline, "hej"}, {expect, "hej\r\n"},
 2007:         {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "\\Qio:get_line(\"getline>\")\\E[.]$"}
 2008:        ], [], [],
 2009:        mk_history_param(Path)),
 2010:     ok.
 2011: 
 2012: shell_history_resize(Config) ->
 2013:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "resize"),
 2014:     rtnode:run(
 2015:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2016:        {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2017:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2018:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"}
 2019:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history_file_bytes","123456"] ++
 2020:           mk_history_param(Path)),
 2021: 
 2022:     {ok, Logs} =
 2023:         rtnode:run(
 2024:           [{sleep,100},
 2025:            {putline, ""},
 2026:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$$"},
 2027:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2028:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2029:            {expect, "echo"}
 2030:           ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history_file_bytes","654321"] ++
 2031:               mk_history_param(Path)),
 2032: 
 2033:     rtnode:check_logs(
 2034:       "erlang.log.1",
 2035:       "The configured log history file size is different from the size "
 2036:       "of the log file on disk", Logs),
 2037: 
 2038:     ok.
 2039: 
 2040: shell_history_eaccess(Config) ->
 2041:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "eaccess"),
 2042:     file:make_dir(filename:dirname(Path)),
 2043:     ok = file:make_dir(Path),
 2044:     {ok, Info} = file:read_file_info(Path),
 2045:     try
 2046:         NoExecMode = Info#file_info.mode band (bnot 8#111),
 2047:         file:write_file_info(Path,Info#file_info{ mode = NoExecMode }),
 2048: 
 2049:         %% Cannot create history log in folder
 2050:         {ok, Logs1} =
 2051:             rtnode:run(
 2052:               [{putline, "echo."},
 2053:                {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2054:               ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2055: 
 2056:         ct:pal("~p",[Logs1]),
 2057:         rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Error handling file", Logs1),
 2058: 
 2059:         %% shell_docs recursively creates the folder to store the
 2060:         %% logs. This test checks that erlang still starts if we
 2061:         %% cannot create the folders to the path.
 2062:         {ok, Logs2} =
 2063:             rtnode:run(
 2064:               [{putline, "echo."},
 2065:                {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2066:               ], [], [], mk_history_param(filename:join(Path,"logs"))),
 2067: 
 2068:         rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Error handling file", Logs2)
 2069: 
 2070:     after
 2071:         file:write_file_info(Path, Info)
 2072:     end,
 2073:     ok.
 2074: 
 2075: shell_history_repair(Config) ->
 2076:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "repair"),
 2077: 
 2078:     %% We stop a node without closing the log
 2079:     shell_history_halt(Path),
 2080: 
 2081:     {ok, Logs} =
 2082:         rtnode:run(
 2083:           [{putline, ""},
 2084:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2085:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2086:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2087:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2088: 
 2089:     %% The regexp below checks that he string is NOT part of the log
 2090:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1",
 2091:                       "The shell history log file was corrupted and was repaired",
 2092:                       false,
 2093:                       Logs),
 2094:     ok.
 2095: 
 2096: shell_history_repair_corrupt(Config) ->
 2097:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "repair_corrupt"),
 2098: 
 2099:     %% We stop a node without closing the log
 2100:     shell_history_halt(Path),
 2101: 
 2102:     %% We corrupt the disklog
 2103:     {ok, D} = file:open(filename:join(Path,"erlang-shell-log.1"), [read,append]),
 2104:     ok = file:write(D, [10,10]),
 2105:     ok = file:close(D),
 2106: 
 2107:     {ok, Logs} =
 2108:         rtnode:run(
 2109:           [{putline, ""},
 2110:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2111:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2112:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2113:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2114: 
 2115:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1",
 2116:                       "The shell history log file was corrupted and was repaired.",
 2117:                       Logs),
 2118:     ok.
 2119: 
 2120: shell_history_corrupt(Config) ->
 2121:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "corrupt"),
 2122: 
 2123:     %% We initialize the shell history log with a known value.
 2124:     rtnode:run(
 2125:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2126:        {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2127:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2128:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"}
 2129:       ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2130: 
 2131:     %% We corrupt the disklog.
 2132:     {ok, D} = file:open(filename:join(Path,"erlang-shell-log.1"), [read, append]),
 2133:     ok = file:write(D, [10, 10]),
 2134:     ok = file:close(D),
 2135: 
 2136:     {ok, Logs} =
 2137:         rtnode:run(
 2138:           [{putline, ""},
 2139:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$"},
 2140:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2141:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2142:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2143:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2144: 
 2145:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Invalid chunk in the file", Logs),
 2146:     ok.
 2147: 
 2148: %% Stop the node without closing the log.
 2149: shell_history_halt(Path) ->
 2150:     try
 2151:         rtnode:run(
 2152:           [{putline, "echo."},
 2153:            {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2154:            {sleep, 2500}, % disk_log internal cache timer is 2000 ms
 2155:            {putline, "halt(0)."},
 2156:            {expect, "\r\n"},
 2157:            {sleep, 1000} %% wait for node to terminate
 2158:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path))
 2159:     catch
 2160:         _:_ ->
 2161:             ok
 2162:     end.
 2163: 
 2164: shell_history_path(Config, TestCase) ->
 2165:     filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2166:                    "shell_history", TestCase]).
 2167: 
 2168: mk_history_param(Path) ->
 2169:     ["-kernel","shell_history","enabled",
 2170:      "-kernel","shell_history_path","\"" ++ Path ++ "\"",
 2171:      "-kernel","shell_history_drop","[\"init:stop().\"]"
 2172:     ].
 2173: 
 2174: shell_history_custom(_Config) ->
 2175:     %% Up key: Ctrl + P = Cp=[$\^p]
 2176:     rtnode:run(
 2177:       [{expect, "1> $"},
 2178:        %% {putline, ""},
 2179:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "0[.]"},
 2180:        {putdata, [$\n]},
 2181:        {expect, "0\r\n"},
 2182:        {putline, "echo."},
 2183:        {expect, "!echo\r\n"} % exclamation mark is printed by custom history module
 2184:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2185:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2186:     ok.
 2187: 
 2188: shell_history_custom_errors(_Config) ->
 2189: 
 2190:     %% Check that we can start with a node with an undefined
 2191:     %% provider module.
 2192:     rtnode:run(
 2193:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2194:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2195:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history","very_broken",
 2196:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2197: 
 2198:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2199:     %% that crashes in load/0.
 2200:     rtnode:run(
 2201:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2202:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2203:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2204:                   "-kernel","provider_load","crash",
 2205:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2206: 
 2207:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2208:     %% that return incorrect in load/0.
 2209:     rtnode:run(
 2210:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2211:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2212:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2213:                   "-kernel","provider_load","badreturn",
 2214:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2215: 
 2216:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2217:     %% that crashes in load/0.
 2218:     rtnode:run(
 2219:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2220:        {expect, "(Disabling shell history logging.|echo)"},
 2221:        {expect, "(Disabling shell history logging.|echo)"}
 2222:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2223:                   "-kernel","provider_add","crash",
 2224:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2225: 
 2226:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2227:     %% that return incorrect in load/0.
 2228:     rtnode:run(
 2229:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2230:        {expect, "It returned {error,badreturn}.\r\n"},
 2231:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2232:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2233:                   "-kernel","provider_add","badreturn",
 2234:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2235: 
 2236:     ok.
 2237: 
 2238: load() ->
 2239:     case application:get_env(kernel,provider_load) of
 2240:         {ok, crash} ->
 2241:             error(crash);
 2242:         {ok, badreturn} ->
 2243:             %% Should return a list of string()
 2244:             ok;
 2245:         _ ->
 2246:             ["0.\n\n"]
 2247:     end.
 2248: 
 2249: add(_Line) ->
 2250:     case application:get_env(kernel,provider_add) of
 2251:         {ok, crash} ->
 2252:             error(crash);
 2253:         {ok, badreturn} ->
 2254:             %% Should return ok
 2255:             {error, badreturn};
 2256:         _ ->
 2257:             io:format("!", [])
 2258:     end.
 2259: 
 2260: %% Tests that local shell can be started by means of job control.
 2261: job_control_local(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2262:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2263: 	old ->
 2264: 	    %% Old shell tests
 2265: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2266: 	new ->
 2267: 	    %% New shell tests
 2268: 	    rtnode:run(
 2269:               [{putline, ""},
 2270:                {expect,  "1> $"},
 2271:                {putline, "2."},
 2272:                {expect,  "\r\n2\r\n"},
 2273:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2274:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2275:                {putline, "s"},
 2276:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2277:                {putline, "c"},
 2278:                {expect,  "\r\nEshell"},
 2279:                {expect,  "1> $"},
 2280:                {putline, "35."},
 2281:                {expect,  "\r\n35\r\n"},
 2282:                {expect,  "2> $"},
 2283:                {putline, "receive M -> M end.\r\n"},
 2284:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2285:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2286:                {putline, "i 3"},
 2287:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2288:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2289:                {putline, "i 2"},
 2290:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2291:                {putline, "c"},
 2292:                {expect,  "[*][*] exception exit: killed"},
 2293:                {expect,  "[23]>"},
 2294:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2295:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2296:                {putline, "k 3"},
 2297:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2298:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2299:                {putline, "k 2"},
 2300:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2301:                {putline, "k"},
 2302:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2303:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2304:                {putline, "c"},
 2305:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2306:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2307:                {putline, "i"},
 2308:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2309:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2310:                {putline, "?"},
 2311:                {expect,  "this message"},
 2312:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2313:                {putline, "h"},
 2314:                {expect,  "this message"},
 2315:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2316:                {putline, "c 1"},
 2317:                {expect, "\r\n"},
 2318:                {putline, "35."},
 2319:                {expect, "\r\n35\r\n"},
 2320:                {expect, "[23]> $"}
 2321:               ]),
 2322:             ok
 2323:     end.
 2324: 
 2325: %% Tests that remote shell can be started by means of job control.
 2326: job_control_remote(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2327:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2328: 	old ->
 2329: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2330: 	_ ->
 2331:             {ok, Peer, NSNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{ args => ["-connect_all","false"],
 2332:                                              peer_down => continue }),
 2333:             try
 2334:                 test_remote_job_control(NSNode)
 2335:             after
 2336:                 peer:stop(Peer)
 2337:             end
 2338:     end.
 2339: 
 2340: %% Tests that remote shell can be started by means of job control to
 2341: %% -noshell node.
 2342: job_control_remote_noshell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2343:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2344: 	old ->
 2345: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2346: 	_ ->
 2347: 	    {ok, Peer, NSNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{ name => peer:random_name(test_remote_job_control),
 2348:                                              args => ["-connect_all","false","-noshell"],
 2349:                                              peer_down => continue }),
 2350:             try
 2351:                 test_remote_job_control(NSNode)
 2352:             after
 2353:                 peer:stop(Peer)
 2354:             end
 2355:     end.
 2356: 
 2357: test_remote_job_control(Node) ->
 2358:     RemNode = peer:random_name(test_remote_job_control),
 2359:     Pid = spawn_link(Node, fun() ->
 2360:                                    receive die ->
 2361:                                            ok
 2362:                                    end
 2363:                            end),
 2364:     PidStr = erpc:call(Node, erlang, pid_to_list, [Pid]),
 2365:     true = erpc:call(Node, erlang, register, [kalaskula,Pid]),
 2366:     PrintedNode = printed_atom(Node),
 2367:     CookieString = printed_atom(erlang:get_cookie()),
 2368: 
 2369:     rtnode:run(
 2370:       [{putline, ""},
 2371:        {putline, "erlang:get_cookie()."},
 2372:        {expect, "\r\n\\Q" ++ CookieString ++ "\\E"},
 2373:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2374:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2375:        {putline, "r " ++ PrintedNode},
 2376:        {expect, "\r\n"},
 2377:        {putline, "j"},
 2378:        {expect, "1  {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2379:        {expect, "2[*] {\\Q"++PrintedNode++"\\E,shell,start,\\[]}"},
 2380:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2381:        {putline, "c"},
 2382:        {expect, "\r\n"},
 2383:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 2384:        {expect, "\\Q(" ++ atom_to_list(Node) ++")1> \\E$"},
 2385:        {putline, "whereis(kalaskula)."},
 2386:        {expect, PidStr},
 2387:        {putline, "kalaskula ! die."},
 2388:        {putline, "exit()."},
 2389:        {expect, "[*][*][*] Shell process terminated!"},
 2390:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2391:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2392:        {putline, "j"},
 2393:        {expect, "1  {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2394:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2395:        {putline, "c"},
 2396:        {expect, "Unknown job"},
 2397:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2398:        {putline, "c 1"},
 2399:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[12]> $"},
 2400:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2401:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2402:        {putline, "j"},
 2403:        {expect, "1[*] {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2404:        {putline, "c"},
 2405:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[123]> $"},
 2406:        {sleep, 100},
 2407:        {putline, "35."},
 2408:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[123]> $"}
 2409:       ], RemNode),
 2410:     Pid ! die,
 2411:     ok.
 2412: 
 2413: %% Tests various control keys.
 2414: ctrl_keys(_Config) ->
 2415:     Cu = [$\^u],
 2416:     Cw = [$\^w],
 2417:     Cy = [$\^y],
 2418:     Home = [27,$O,$H],
 2419:     End = [27,$O,$F],
 2420:     rtnode:run(
 2421:       [{putline,""},
 2422:        {putline,"2."},
 2423:        {expect,"2"},
 2424:        {putline,"\"hello "++Cw++"world\"."},	% test <CTRL>+W
 2425:        {expect,"\"world\""},
 2426:        {putline,"\"hello "++Cu++"\"world\"."},	% test <CTRL>+U
 2427:        {expect,"\"world\""},
 2428:        {putline,"world\"."++Home++"\"hello "},	% test <HOME>
 2429:        {expect,"\"hello world\""},
 2430:        {putline,"world"++Home++"\"hello "++End++"\"."},	% test <END>
 2431:        {expect,"\"hello world\""},
 2432:        {putline,"\"hello world\""++Cu++Cy++"."},
 2433:        {expect,"\"hello world\""}] ++
 2434:           wordLeft() ++ wordRight()),
 2435:     ok.
 2436: 
 2437: wordLeft() ->
 2438:     L1 = "\e\e[D",
 2439:     L2 = "\e[5D",
 2440:     L3 = "\e[1;5D",
 2441:     wordLeft(L1) ++ wordLeft(L2) ++ wordLeft(L3).
 2442: 
 2443: wordLeft(Chars) ->
 2444:     End = "\eOF",
 2445:     [{putline,"\"world\""++Chars++"hello "++End++"."},
 2446:      {expect,"\"hello world\""}].
 2447: 
 2448: wordRight() ->
 2449:     R1 = "\e\e[C",
 2450:     R2 = "\e[5C",
 2451:     R3 = "\e[1;5C",
 2452:     wordRight(R1) ++ wordRight(R2) ++ wordRight(R3).
 2453: 
 2454: wordRight(Chars) ->
 2455:     Home = "\eOH",
 2456:     [{putline,"world"++Home++"\"hello "++Chars++"\"."},
 2457:      {expect,"\"hello world\""}].
 2458: 
 2459: %% Test that -remsh works
 2460: remsh_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2461:     {ok, Peer, TargetNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
 2462:     TargetNodeStr = printed_atom(TargetNode),
 2463:     [_Name,Host] = string:split(atom_to_list(node()), "@"),
 2464: 
 2465:     PreCmds = [{putline,""},
 2466:                {putline,"node()."},
 2467:                {expect, "\\Q" ++ TargetNodeStr ++ "\\E\r\n"}],
 2468: 
 2469:     PostCmds = quit_hosting_node(),
 2470: 
 2471:     %% Test that remsh works with explicit -sname.
 2472:     HostNode = atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ "_host",
 2473:     HostNodeStr = printed_atom(list_to_atom(HostNode ++ "@" ++ Host)),
 2474:     rtnode:run(
 2475:       PreCmds ++
 2476:           [{putline,"nodes()."},
 2477:            {expect, "\\Q" ++ HostNodeStr ++ "\\E"}] ++
 2478:           PostCmds,
 2479:       HostNode, " ", "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr),
 2480: 
 2481:     %% Test that remsh works without -sname.
 2482:     rtnode:run(PreCmds ++ PostCmds, [], " ", "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr),
 2483: 
 2484:     %% Test that if multiple remsh are given, we select the first
 2485:     rtnode:run([{expect, "Multiple"}] ++ PreCmds ++ PostCmds,
 2486:                [], " ",
 2487:                "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr ++ " -remsh invalid_node"),
 2488: 
 2489:     peer:stop(Peer),
 2490: 
 2491:     ok.
 2492: 
 2493: %% Test that if we cannot connect to a node, we get a correct error
 2494: remsh_error(_Config) ->
 2495:     "Could not connect to \"invalid_node\"\n" =
 2496:         os:cmd(ct:get_progname() ++ " -remsh invalid_node").
 2497: 
 2498: quit_hosting_node() ->
 2499:     %% Command sequence for entering a shell on the hosting node.
 2500:     [{putdata, "\^g"},
 2501:      {expect, "--> $"},
 2502:      {putline, "s"},
 2503:      {expect, "--> $"},
 2504:      {putline, "c"},
 2505:      {expect, ["Eshell"]},
 2506:      {expect, ["1> $"]}].
 2507: 
 2508: %% Test that -remsh works with long names.
 2509: remsh_longnames(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2510:     %% If we cannot resolve the domain, we need to add localhost to the longname
 2511:     Domain =
 2512:         case inet_db:res_option(domain) of
 2513:             [] ->
 2514:                 "@127.0.0.1";
 2515:             _ -> ""
 2516:         end,
 2517:     Name = peer:random_name(?FUNCTION_NAME),
 2518:     case rtnode:start(" -name " ++ Name ++ Domain) of
 2519:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, SNode, SState} ->
 2520:             try
 2521:                 {ok, _CRPid, CTPid, CNode, CState} =
 2522:                     rtnode:start("-name undefined" ++ Domain ++
 2523:                                      " -remsh " ++ Name),
 2524:                 try
 2525:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2526:                            SNode,
 2527:                            STPid,
 2528:                            [{putline, ""},
 2529:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2530:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"}], 1),
 2531:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2532:                            CNode,
 2533:                            CTPid,
 2534:                            [{putline, ""},
 2535:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2536:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"} | quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2537:                 after
 2538:                     rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(CState))
 2539:                 end
 2540:             after
 2541:                 rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(SState))
 2542:             end;
 2543:         {skip, _} = Else ->
 2544:             Else
 2545:     end.
 2546: 
 2547: %% Test that -remsh works without epmd.
 2548: remsh_no_epmd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2549:     EPMD_ARGS = "-start_epmd false -erl_epmd_port 12346 ",
 2550:     Name = ?CT_PEER_NAME(),
 2551:     case rtnode:start([],"ERL_EPMD_PORT=12345 ",
 2552:                       EPMD_ARGS ++ " -sname " ++ Name) of
 2553:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, SNode, SState} ->
 2554:             try
 2555:                 ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2556:                        SNode,
 2557:                        STPid,
 2558:                        [{putline, ""},
 2559:                         {putline, "node()."},
 2560:                         {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"}], 1),
 2561:                 {ok, _CRPid, CTPid, CNode, CState} =
 2562:                     rtnode:start([],"ERL_EPMD_PORT=12345 ",
 2563:                                  EPMD_ARGS ++ " -remsh "++Name),
 2564:                 try
 2565:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2566:                            CNode,
 2567:                            CTPid,
 2568:                            [{putline, ""},
 2569:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2570:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"} | quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2571:                 after
 2572:                     rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(CState))
 2573:                 end
 2574:             after
 2575:                 rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(SState))
 2576:             end;
 2577:         {skip, _} = Else ->
 2578:             Else
 2579:     end.
 2580: remsh_expand_compatibility_25(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2581:     {ok, _Peer, TargetNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{}), %% Create a vsn 26 node
 2582:     NodeName = atom_to_list(TargetNode), %% compatibility
 2583:     %% Start a node on vsn 25 but run the shell on vsn 26
 2584:     case rtnode:start(peer:random_name(), "stty columns 200; ERL_AFLAGS= ", "-remsh "++NodeName, [{release, "25"}|Config]) of
 2585:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, _, SState} ->
 2586:             try
 2587:                 ok = rtnode:send_commands(undefined,
 2588:                        STPid,
 2589:                        [{putdata, "erlang:is_atom\t"},
 2590:                         {expect, "\\Qerlang:is_atom(\\E"}|
 2591:                         quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2592:             after
 2593:                 Logs = rtnode:stop(SState),
 2594:                 rtnode:dump_logs(Logs)
 2595:             end;
 2596:         Else when element(1, Else) =/= ok -> Else
 2597:     end.
 2598: remsh_expand_compatibility_later_version(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2599:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2600:     case ?CT_PEER_REL([], "25", PrivDir) of
 2601:         not_available -> {skip, "25 not available"};
 2602:         {ok, _Peer, TargetNode}  ->
 2603:             NodeName = atom_to_list(TargetNode),
 2604:             %% Start a node on later version but run the shell on vsn 25
 2605:             case rtnode:start(peer:random_name(), "stty columns 200; ERL_AFLAGS= ", "-remsh " ++ NodeName, Config) of
 2606:                 {ok, _SRPid, STPid, _, SState} ->
 2607:                     try
 2608:                         ok = rtnode:send_commands(undefined,
 2609:                             STPid,
 2610:                             [{putdata, "erlang:is_atom\t"},
 2611:                              {expect, "\\Qerlang:is_atom(\\E"}|
 2612:                              quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2613:                     after
 2614:                         Logs = rtnode:stop(SState),
 2615:                         rtnode:dump_logs(Logs)
 2616:                     end;
 2617:                 Else when element(1, Else) =/= ok -> Else
 2618:             end
 2619:     end.
 2620: 
 2621: printed_atom(A) ->
 2622:     lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~w", [A])).
